title: The Netherlands Commits to “Maintain” ESA Contribution Levels Through 2028
summary:
The Dutch government has decided to contribute €344.3 million to European Space Agency (ESA) over the next three years. The government also announced that, with the addition of its national space programmes, the country would spend a total of €550 million from 2026 to 2028. On 10 October, the country’s Council of Ministers approved a […]
The post The Netherlands Commits to “Maintain” ESA Contribution Levels Through 2028 appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Huge commercial Chinese solid rocket launches 3 satellites from barge in the Yellow Sea
summary:
Chinese launch startup Orienspace successfully conducted its second launch late Friday, with a Gravity-1 solid rocket lifting off from a barge in the Yellow Sea.
The post Huge commercial Chinese solid rocket launches 3 satellites from barge in the Yellow Sea appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Planet announces new line of satellites for daily Earth imaging
summary:
Planet has announced a new class of imaging satellites that will replace a line of spacecraft dating back to the company’s earliest days.

title: Thales Alenia Space Inaugurates New €100M Satellite Factory
summary:
Thales Alenia Space officially inaugurated its new Space Smart Factory in Rome on 7 October, with operations expected to begin before the end of the year. In April 2023, Thales Alenia Space, a joint venture between Thales and Leonardo, secured an initial contract from the Italian Space Agency (ASI) to lead the development of the […]

title: New Zealand charts continued growth of its space industry
summary:

title: U.S. Space Force picks Blue Origin bid for expanding satellite processing at Cape Canaveral
summary: This is the second award from the National Security Space Launch (NSSL) Space Vehicle (SV) Processing Commercial Solutions Opening (CSO) contract. Blue Origin will receive $78.25 million for the work.
